channel.title: Laptop Project
channel.description:
Many of you have heard of my so called "laptop project"
You may not know what it is.
[img]http://img205.imageshack.us/img205/5091/dsc004191ik6.jpg[/img]
Now that you know what I'm talking about, I'll get to the main point. The whole purpose of the thread was not to show off. I'm in need of help right now.
I was completing the bottom portion of the laptop (got my frame all ready) when I noticed I couldn't turn it on anymore.
BIOS reports no hard drives detected. I tried putting new ones in. Same deal. I got sad. Looks like the SATA controllers are dead. I found out my only option is to get some USB hard drives hooked up and work off those. I'm left with a simple choice:
-Use linux LiveCD for the rest of my life (fast boot distro recommend please) and access all my info from an external hard drive (internally over usb2.0) -Figure out USB boot without a flash drive (HD instead) and use that somehow (rare old laptop) -Boot from CD, get a program to make it boot from an USB drive into windows with a VM or something.
Either way, I'd like games on my laptop and some degree of windows. Any ideas?
Thanks for reading.

item.title: Laptop Project
item.dc:creator: @boriz boriz
item.description:
@boriz wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:13, topic:261269”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=345030.msg2661748#msg2661748 date=1234232038]
Why is boriz so rich?
[/quote]
wut would make u think he is?[/quote]

I’m actually quite broke at the moment.

This laptop was refurbished, purchased in ~2007. It was 1,100 CAN+tax
It was a birthday present from my dad.

Since computers are a hobby of mine, I tend up to save up and use my money on electronics, instead of social life etc. Gonna change that very soon after I finish this project.

Now that I’m broke, I had a good friend of mine donated me some money for my project because he really wanted me to finish it. I’ll return the favor by letting him keep my laptop when I don’t use it.

Breakdown of components bought:

-Old ass laptop
-$20 logitech speakers
-$30 remote control relay
-$50 logitech webcam (I had to get a good one cause refurbished .3MP are shit as fuck. Lighting sensor is crucial)
-$30 wireless vx300 mouse (just bought) [gonna be sweet how I have the receiver hidden away]
-Used 500GB hard drive (quite expensive back in the day)
-Dad got me an old USB-SATA/IDE controller a while ago, together with a power brick for it
-Suitcase was donated by a family friend who didn’t need it

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Project
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

The egg cook was taking too long, so after 1 hour I removed it and put it on the stove.

Stats: Starting temp of laptop: 73C
Temp after pot/egg on for 2 mins: 66C
Temp after pot/egg on for 40 mins: 66C
Temp after pot egg on for 1 hour: 66C

Temp of pot:
Start: 15C
2 Mins: 18C
40 Mins: 35C
55 Mins: 50C
60 Mins: 52C

After pot removed:
Temp hit in 5 mins: 70C
Temp after most programs closed: 67C

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Project
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:8, topic:261269”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=345030.msg2661087#msg2661087 date=1234203205]
Looks as if the only thing you put effort into was the screen.

Your probably ESD’d the sata controller.

it would be better if you bolted all the laptops mobo on behind the screen and added a touch system then put it in a thin box like a tablet. (maybe leave the back cover clear plastic/glass)
[/quote]

That will require quite a good air flow. Just turn a laptop on for a few hours and feel the back of the monitor. Same applies to the MoBo. Put those together and you can cook eggs on it.[/quote]
I will try that then put a video on youtube.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Project
item.dc:creator: @boriz boriz
item.description:
@boriz wrote:

I’m not worried about air flow because even when the laptop had shitty plastic casing with tiny holes, it got enough cooling. Having huge holes will definitely help.

I don’t like the touchscreen method because the laptop is heavy as fuck as it is.

In case you were wondering what I’m working with.

Engadget

Toshiba's Qosmio G35-AV600

It hasn't even been a month and a half and already Toshiba's upgraded the Qosmio G30 we saw launched at CES with their new Qosmio G35-AV600. It's still got the...

I’m planning on installing a 500gig hard drive into the laptop permanently, still not sure if I can usb boot. Any other options?

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Project
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:7, topic:261269”]Looks as if the only thing you put effort into was the screen.

Your probably ESD’d the sata controller.

it would be better if you bolted all the laptops mobo on behind the screen and added a touch system then put it in a thin box like a tablet. (maybe leave the back cover clear plastic/glass)[/quote]

That will require quite a good air flow. Just turn a laptop on for a few hours and feel the back of the monitor. Same applies to the MoBo. Put those together and you can cook eggs on it.

item.title: Laptop Project
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:2, topic:261269”]is that a suitcase? i am not aware of your project, what type of lcd is it? explain all that shit, looks funny as hell.[/quote]The shit you asked initially is totally redundant to his problems.

Perhaps not throwing everything into a suitcase would benefit you.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Project
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Boot a Linux Live CD and use Wine is a simple solution.

I am actually planning to make a Mac Style PC with all the Components at the back of the monitor but I’m worried about heating issues. How did you get the power supply and fan into a briefcase?
Even with a fan i am still concerned about the air-flow in such a compact sapce.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Project
item.dc:creator: @boriz boriz
item.description:
@boriz wrote:

xEnt:

is that a suitcase? i am not aware of your project, what type of lcd is it? explain all that shit, looks funny as hell.

Much easier to explain when I’m finished. But I’ll go right ahead so nobody asks me the same questions:

-It’s inside an aluminum combination 6 digit suitcase
-Just a regular dual core laptop with a case from a briefcase
-Regular laptop 17" widescreen LCD
-It will look too epic when finished. This isn’t even half done.
-Going to get a replacement hard drive TODAY with SATA interface

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:3, topic:261269”]Nope It’s all on one chip. The upside is I’ll have 500 GB of whatever I want
Is there no way to replace the sata controllers?[/quote]

Read full topic
